thread.title: Zamalek's Kahraba heavily fined for insistence to take penalty against Ahly
thread.title_full: Zamalek's Kahraba heavily fined for insistence to take penalty against Ahly - Egyptian Football - Sports - Ahram Online

author: english.ahram.org.eg
title: Zamalek's Kahraba heavily fined for insistence to take penalty against Ahly
text:
Related Egypt's Zamalek give coach Ferreira vote of confidence after Super Cup loss Zamalek chairman Mortada Mansour claims he might coach the club Zamalek chairman told derby Spanish ref ‘you are very, very bad’ Zamalek to fine skipper Emam for Sobhi reaction Key Zamalek defender Gabr to miss league opener Zamalek chairman to freeze out coach Ferreira after Super Cup loss Zamalek president slams coach Ferreira after Ahly defeat Zamalek winger Mahmoud Kahraba was handed a hefty LE300,000 fine for his insistence to take a penalty during Thursday's 3-2 loss to Cairo rivals Ahly in the Egyptian Super Cup.
Kahraba missed the chance to put Zamalek 2-0 up in the first half when his weak spot kick was saved by Ahly keeper Sherif Ekramy.
He insisted to take the penalty that he won despite a furious reaction from Zamalek's Portuguese coach Jesualdo Ferreira on the touchline.
Attacking midfielder Mohamed Ibrahim was fined LE150,000 for "refusing to obey his coach" while skipper Hazem Emam was fined LE100,000 for entering the field when he clashed with Ahly players.
Zamalek, who clinched both the Egyptian Premier League and Egypt Cup trophies this season, gave Ferreira a vote of confidence after Sunday's board meeting.
